from rest_framework import serializers
from ..models import Event, EventCategory, EventOrganizer, EventGallery

# Serializer for listing events (basic view)
class EventListSerializers(serializers.ModelSerializer):
    # Nested fields for related models (just showing names or basic details)
    category = serializers.StringRelatedField(many=True)  # Show related categories by name
    organizer = serializers.StringRelatedField(many=True)  # Show related organizers by name

    class Meta:
        model = Event
        fields = '__all__'


# Serializer for retrieving detailed event information
class EventRetrieveSerializers(serializers.ModelSerializer):
    # Nested fields for related models (showing detailed info)
    category = serializers.StringRelatedField(many=True)
    organizer = serializers.StringRelatedField(many=True)
    gallery = serializers.StringRelatedField(many=True)  # Optional: For retrieving related images

    class Meta:
        model = Event
        fields = '__all__'


# Serializer for creating or updating events
class EventWriteSerializers(serializers.ModelSerializer):
    # Nested fields for related models
    category = serializers.PrimaryKeyRelatedField(queryset=EventCategory.objects.all(), many=True)
    organizer = serializers.PrimaryKeyRelatedField(queryset=EventOrganizer.objects.all(), many=True)
    gallery = serializers.PrimaryKeyRelatedField(queryset=EventGallery.objects.all(), many=True)
    
    class Meta:
        model = Event
        fields = [
            'event_name', 'start_date', 'end_date', 'duration', 'event_type', 'venue', 'online_seat_limit', 
            'offline_seat_limit', 'is_offline_seat_limit', 'is_online_seat_limit', 'is_registration', 
            'registration_link', 'registration_type', 'amount', 'amount_type', 'amount_country', 
            'description', 'is_featured_event', 'category', 'organizer', 'gallery', 'created_date_time', 
            'created_date', 'updated_date'
        ]
    
    def create(self, validated_data):
        # Handle the creation of related fields (many-to-many relationships)
        category_data = validated_data.pop('category')
        organizer_data = validated_data.pop('organizer')
        gallery_data = validated_data.pop('gallery')

        # Create the Event instance
        event = Event.objects.create(**validated_data)

        # Handle many-to-many relationships
        event.category.set(category_data)
        event.organizer.set(organizer_data)
        event.gallery.set(gallery_data)

        return event

    def update(self, instance, validated_data):
        # Handle the updating of related fields (many-to-many relationships)
        category_data = validated_data.pop('category', None)
        organizer_data = validated_data.pop('organizer', None)
        gallery_data = validated_data.pop('gallery', None)

        # Update fields that are present in validated_data
        for attr, value in validated_data.items():
            setattr(instance, attr, value)
        
        # Update many-to-many relationships
        if category_data is not None:
            instance.category.set(category_data)
        if organizer_data is not None:
            instance.organizer.set(organizer_data)
        if gallery_data is not None:
            instance.gallery.set(gallery_data)

        # Save the updated instance
        instance.save()

        return instance
